meanings.definition: A painful, pus-filled bump on the skin caused by an infection of a hair follicle or oil gland.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with multiple boils on his back.
meanings.sent2: She applied a warm compress to the boils to help them heal faster.
meanings.sent3: The boils on his face made him look like he had a bad case of chickenpox.
meanings.sent4: The kitchen was a bubbling cauldron of boils as the soup simmered on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The boils were so tender that even the lightest touch caused immense pain.

meanings.definition: To reach or be brought to the boiling point.
meanings.sent1: The water boils quickly when you turn up the heat.
meanings.sent2: She boils the pasta until it is perfectly al dente.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room boils over as the countdown to midnight begins.
meanings.sent4: His anger boils like a pot left unattended on a hot stove.
meanings.sent5: The tension between the two rivals boils to a breaking point during the final match.

meanings.definition: To be filled with intense emotion or anger.
meanings.sent1: Her frustration boils over when she can't find her keys.
meanings.sent2: He boils with jealousy whenever he sees his ex with someone new.
meanings.sent3: The argument between the siblings boils down to who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The political debate boils into a heated exchange of accusations and insults.
meanings.sent5: His blood boils with righteous indignation at the injustice he witnessed.
